snippet: Four days after Hurricane Sandy, the effort to secure enough gas for the region moved to the forefront of recovery work. In New York, the Taxi Commission warned of a thinner fleet.
abstract: “Widespread gas shortages in New York region stir fears among residents and disrupt  rescue and emergency services in wake of Hurricane Sandy;” effort to secure enough gas for region moves to forefront of recovery work; tiny increments of progress in recovery effort are overshadowed by new estimates of storm’s financial cost, struggles to restore power, and rising death toll.

byline.contributor:
Reporting on the storm was
contributed by Russ Buettner,
Annie Correal, Alison
Leigh Cowan, Sheri Fink,
Joseph Goldstein, J. David
Goodman, Denise Grady,
Winnie Hu, Randy Leonard,
William K. Rashbaum,
Ray Rivera, Liz Robbins,
Nate Schweber, Kirk Semple,
Stacey Stowe, Rebecca
White and Vivian Yee.

lead_paragraph: Four days after Hurricane Sandy, the effort to secure enough gas for the region moved to the forefront of recovery work. In New York, the Taxi Commission warned of a thinner fleet.

headline.main: Gasoline Runs Short, Adding Woes to Storm Recovery
headline.print_headline: Gasoline Shortages Disrupting Recovery From Hurricane
